arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with a Stryker Triathlon CR TKA
arm_group.description: Patients implanted with a Stryker Triathlon Cruciate Retaining Total Knee Arthroplasty.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with a Zimmer PCR TKA
arm_group.description: Patients implanted with a Zimmer Poster Cruciate Retaining Total Knee Arthroplasty.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will compare the kinematics and sound/vibration data collected from patients with
      implants created by different manufacturers to see which of these implants provides a more
      normal-like kinematic pattern compared to the normal knee.

clinical_study.brief_title: In Vivo Kinematics Comparison of Stryker or Zimmer TKA

detailed_description.textblock:
A better understanding of knee joint kinematics is important to explain premature
      polyethylene wear failures within knee implants and to help design a prosthesis that most
      closely approximates the normal knee. Therefore, the objectives for this study are to
      compare the in vivo kinematic patterns for subjects implanted with either a Stryker
      Triathlon CR total knee arthroplasty (TKA) or Zimmer PCR TKA design to determine if there
      are any kinematic differences between these TKA designs and to compare the sounds emitted
      from each kind of implant during activities. Each subject will be asked to undergo a
      fluoroscopic evaluation while performing weight-bearing activities under surveillance using
      the University of Tennessee's new mobile tracking fluoroscopic unit while wearing sound
      sensors to correlate the sounds emitted from the implanted knees with the movements while
      performing activities. The mobile fluoroscopy unit is approved for use by the State of
      Tennessee on a study-by-study basis after IRB approval is obtained for each study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Must be at least 3 months post-operative with no other surgical procedures conducted
             within the past 6 months

          -  Must have body weight of less than 250 lbs

          -  Must have Body Mass Index of less than 38

          -  Must be judged clinically successful with a Knee Society Score >90

          -  Must have 100% post-operative passive flexion with no ligamentous laxity or pain

          -  Must be able to walk on level ground without aid of any kind

          -  Must be able to ascend and descend a ramp with a 10 degree incline with no assistance

          -  Must be willing to sign both Informed Consent and HIPAA forms

          -  Must be between 160 cm (5'3) and 193 cm (6'4) tall

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant or potentially pregnant females

          -  Unwilling to sign Informed Consent or HIPAA forms

study_pop.textblock:
Participants will be patients of Dr. Harold E. Cates of Tennessee Orthopaedic Clinics and
        must have been implanted with either a Stryker Triathlon CR TKA or Zimmer PCR TKA

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with a Stryker Triathlon CR TKA
Patients with a Zimmer PCR TKA

facility.name: Tennessee Orthopaedic Clinic, Tennessee Orthopaedic Foundation for Education & Research
Perkins Hall, The University of Tennessee

clinical_study.official_title: In Vivo Comparison of Kinematics for Patients Implanted With Either a Stryker or a Zimmer PCR TKA

primary_outcome.description: Anterior/posterior medial and lateral condyle contact positions; axial rotation of the femoral component relative to the tibial component; condylar lift-off will be determined by measuring the distances from the medial and lateral condyles to the polyethylene insert surface; weight-bearing range-of-motion
primary_outcome.measure: Compare the kinematic patterns of patients implanted with a Stryker Triathlon Cruciate Retaining (CR) Total Knee Arthroplasty (TKA) versus a Zimmer Posterior Cruciate Retaining (PCR) TKA.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Vibroarthrography data will be co-related to the occurrence of the cam-post engagement; correlate vibrations within the knee acquired during simultaneous data collection during activity performance under fluoroscopy with the kinematics acquired from data.
secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the sound emitted from the implanted joints during the kinematic activities.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Retrospective
